programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: The guys find a rifle with a matching cutlass bayonet, as well as a bowling pin-setter, at an auction in California and hope to strike a deal that will result in a profit.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Auctions in Garland bring a day of dashed hopes and sweet profits. Plus, a new buyer begins to throw some of the bidders off their game.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The buyers head to Fort Worth, where a local auctioneer stirs up trouble when he joins as bidder.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Star Trek actor William Shatner presents Mike and Frank with a list of rare items he wants them to track down for his house.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: The swamp is hit by a devastating hurricane, while one of the hunters suffers an alligator bite that forces him to drop out of the contest.

programme.title: Ernie the Wildman
programme.desc: Following Ernie Brown Jr in Kentucky as he tries to relieve businesses and home-owners of unwanted and potentially deadly pests, including snakes, venomous spiders and possums.

programme.title: Ernie the Wildman
programme.desc: Following Ernie Brown Jr in Kentucky as he tries to relieve businesses and home-owners of unwanted and potentially deadly pests, including snakes, venomous spiders and possums.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys try to make a deal over a valuable teddy bear, a 19th-century pistol and a Second World War gas mask.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team is offered antique photographs of outlaw Jesse James, and an amplifier for a 1950s organ.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The Golds are forced to take action when they witness a hustler scamming their customers in the car park. Plus, Seth and Ashley finally come to blows.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Kane Hodder, an actor who played Jason Voorhees in four of the Friday the 13th films, comes to American Jewelry to have a gold pendant featuring his trademark hockey goalie mask.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Expert investigations into the possibility that reptilian aliens are more than a pop-culture creation and a favourite of works of science-fiction.

programme.title: In Search Of
programme.desc: Zachary Quinto searches for and tests several possibilities that may explain the mystery and phenomena of Superhuman strength.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Ricky and Bubba's nemesis Kenny Stowe shows up at tense auctions in Mesquite, where struggling Victor proves he is desperate for bargains.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Lesa Lewis and Jerry Simpson compete against Jenny Grumbles and Mary Padian at an auction on their own turf in Longview.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les and Ashley must properly determine the value of a shoddy bike. Meanwhile, Seth enters into a conflict with a New Jersey man, and a customer desires a TV.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth plots to empty the overflowing warehouse behind Les's back, but risks upsetting his father.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team examines one of the rarest guns in American history, and a tyre that once belonged to Nascar driver Dale Earnhardt.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys are thrilled at the chance to buy a dollar bill signed by Clark Gable, while Rick gets his hands on a memento of one-time US president Ulysses S Grant's funeral.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell makes the most expensive bid of his career, and Ivy learns a lesson that radically changes his approach to locker buying.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Ivy and Rene pool their resources to get the better of Darrell and Brandon, while Jarrod and Brandi regain their passion for bidding.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones uncover a Swedish rifle and a golf ball retriever, and try to sell them at an auction in Panorama City.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: At a storage unit sale in Riverside, Ton Jones breaks the rules of auction hunting to take on a rival with shady bidding tactics.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: An English bidder turns up at Fort Worth. Victor acquires some spy equipment, while Ricky and Bubba have their eyes on something far more dangerous.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Ricky and Bubba plan to get revenge on a rival at an auction in Dallas, and arguments erupt surrounding a musical instrument.

programme.title: In Search Of
programme.desc: Actor Zachary Quinto hosts this reboot of the 1970s documentary series that explores the unexplained. He begins with a search for extraterrestrial life.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Investigations into whether ancient tales of beings with super-human powers could be inspired by extra- terrestrials who came to Earth in the past.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth goes against Les's advice and buys an old Chevy sign at Detroit's annual Woodward Dream Cruise event and hopes that he has made the right decision.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les and Seth confront the fact that Ashley's attitude is costing them much-needed business, and a customer with a fascination with serial killers brings in some scary paraphernalia.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les is swindled out of thousands of dollars after a crafty seller flogs him a fake luxury watch, so he tries to find a way to get his money back.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les tries to prove to his staff that he is still an integral part of the pawn business after he makes a series of bad purchases.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones enter a bidding war for promising-looking storage units, but the ice-resurfacing machine they discover may not be as valuable as anticipated.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones discover a high-powered amateur rocket and a piece of machinery used for mining gold at a storage unit in Littleton, Colorado.

programme.title: Paranormal: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: An Oregon man shoots some incredible Bigfoot footage, UFOs gather over Texas and an active poltergeist appears in Wales.

programme.title: The Lowe Files
programme.desc: Actor Rob Lowe and his two sons take a trip to the Dugway Proving Ground, a military testing base in the Utah countryside, considered by many to be the new Area 51.

programme.title: The Lowe Files
programme.desc: Actor Rob Lowe and his sons visit two specialists in Santa Barbara, California to master the secret art of remote viewing - a special kind of telekinesis.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The latest round of auctions prompts a career-changing bid from Ivy, while Jarrod and Brandi's Long Beach store is mired in gossip.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers go to Murieta, California, where Jarrod and Brandi hope to turn their recent run of misfortune around.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones uncover a Swedish rifle and a golf ball retriever, and try to sell them at an auction in Panorama City.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: At a storage unit sale in Riverside, Ton Jones breaks the rules of auction hunting to take on a rival with shady bidding tactics.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Greg Davies returns with the comedy game show. Doc Brown, Richard Osman, Jon Richardson, Katherine Ryan and Joe Wilkinson accept a potato-throwing challenge.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Outnumbered star Hugh Dennis, presenter Ben Fogle, newsreader Kate Silverton and Strictly Come Dancing judge Craig Revel Horwood are this week's guests on the comedy panel show. Team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack guide the contestants as they try to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Presented by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: John Bishop, Chris Addison, Joanna Page and Patsy Palmer join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves in the comedy panel show hosted by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: Lister has his kidneys removed following an altercation with a deranged droid and the only solution is to ask Cat, the most selfish creature in the universe, to give him one of his. Sci-fi comedy, starring Craig Charles, Chris Barrie and Robert Llewellyn.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: Rimmer finally tires of being embarrassed by his fellow crewmen, and decides to take his revenge by forcing them to spend 12 weeks in strict quarantine after they are exposed to a deadly virus. Sci-fi comedy, starring Craig Charles and Chris Barrie.

programme.title: The Indestructibles
programme.desc: Tim and Gendle are inspired by a game of Top Golf, though they replace balls with bikes, and take the action to a lake littered with targets.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Late Nite Eats
programme.desc: Chef Jordan Andino is on the hunt to find restaurants that reign supreme in the late-night food scene, meeting other chefs to taste their most popular dishes.

programme.title: Late Nite Eats
programme.desc: in Oakland, Jordan Andino is blown away by Chef Chris' interpretation of traditional Korean Bibimbap - served with softshell crab, kimchee and grilled pineapple.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank go on the road in search for a unique motorbike, only to receive some shocking news from an appraiser.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Nat and John's day in Glasgow gets off to a flying start, but Dan's dirty tactics lead to mayhem within the team. Meanwhile, George finds himself with a new pet.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: The bidders head to Preston, where Dan's arrogant behaviour gets him into trouble once again. Presented by Sean Kelly.

programme.title: Eddie Eats America
programme.desc: Eddie visits the Garden State for supersized breakfast in a New Jersey diner, a tryout with ice hockey pros the NJ Devils - and an epic struggle with an eight-hot-dog challenge.

programme.title: Eddie Eats America
programme.desc: In Austin, Eddie Hall takes on Superbike legend Colin 'Texas Tornado' Edwards in a strength vs speed race - and sets his own eating challenge from eight of the city's food trucks.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The presenters square up to their Australian counterparts in an automotive version of the Ashes, with challenges including rallying, drifting and a double-decker car race. Jeremy Clarkson also test-drives the Ferrari 599 GTO, and Boris Becker gets behind the wheel of the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Coverage of the offbeat event from Turin, Italy, where teams create vehicles without engines and race downhill.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and Richard Hammond try to solve the problems that increasingly complex cars pose to an ageing population. They design a vehicle for elderly people and put it to the test in Dorset with the help of three pensioners. Meanwhile, James May gets acquainted with a revamped Range Rover in London before pitting the luxurious off-roader against an autonomous military machine in Nevada. Actor James McAvoy tackles the test track in the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Top Gear: Winter Blunderland
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May present their best winter challenges.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May travel to America for an interstate road trip, completing various challenges along the way. Starting in Miami, they each buy a car for less than $1,000 and drive to New Orleans, where they set out to give their vehicles away to people who suffered in Hurricane Katrina.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Chris Harris, Freddie Flintoff and Paddy McGuinness get to grips with a disused hearse, and give it a new lease of life as the ultimate family car. On the track, Chris puts the Dallara Stradale through its paces, while royal couple Zara and Mike Tindall go head-to-head in Star in a Reasonably Fast Car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Paddy McGuinness and Freddie Flintoff go on a jungle adventure in Borneo with the Gurkhas, in a pair of rare but very cheap old cars. Back in the studio, Chris Harris gets behind the wheel of the world's most luxurious SUV, and the gang is joined by Bob Mortimer.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Greg Davies sets tasks for a group of comedians, with help from Alex Horne. In this edition, Jon Richardson strives to create the perfect music video.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by TV presenter Patrick Kielty, actor Bernard Cribbins, Dragons' Den judge Deborah Meaden and comedian Mark Watson on the comedy panel show. Rob Brydon chairs as the contestants try to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: John Bishop, Chris Addison, Joanna Page and Patsy Palmer join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves in the comedy panel show hosted by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.sub-title: Would I Lie to You? - The Unseen Bits
programme.desc: A compilation of unseen material from this series of the comedy panel show hosted by Rob Brydon. Team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by celebrity guests to dupe their opponents with plausible lies, featuring contestants including Ronnie Corbett, Bernard Cribbins, Richard E Grant, Jack Dee, Martin Clunes, Julian Clary and Sanjeev Bhaskar.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: An experiment with a machine that can make duplicates of an object goes wrong and crew members are aghast to encounter their evil 'doppelgangers'.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: Starbug crashes while trying to evade a giant squid, but instead of dying the crew members discover all their memories of their time on Red Dwarf had been generated by a video game - one they had been playing extremely badly. Sci-fi comedy, starring Craig Charles, Chris Barrie, Danny John-Jules and Robert Llewellyn, with guest star Timothy Spall.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Comedy actress Katherine Parkinson, dance guru Louie Spence, comedian David O'Doherty and breakfast news presenter Bill Turnbull join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the panel show, hosted by Rob Brydon. The aim of the game is to hoodwink opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies - like whether Louie makes himself cry before every performance and if David actually is seeing a psychiatrist to cure a strange addiction.

programme.title: Dara O Briain's Go 8 Bit
programme.desc: Broadcaster Anna Richardson and comedian Nish Kumar play a series of video games, including Virtua Fighter, Alien: Isolation, Worms Armageddon and Shovel Knight.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Greg Davies sets tasks for a group of comedians, with help from Alex Horne. In this edition, Jon Richardson strives to create the perfect music video.

programme.title: World War Weird
programme.desc: Bizarre events during wartime, featuring a Nazi anti-gravity device, phantom cities built during the Second World War, Stalin's cursed tomb and poultry of mass destruction.

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: The changing landscape of the coastline from Newcastle to Hull. Neil Oliver explores the ancient coastal home of the Venerable Bede, and goes to Bridlington to learn about the 200-year struggle to design an unsinkable lifeboat. Mark Horton discovers how laser technology could predict coastal erosion, Dick Strawbridge finds out how Middlesbrough's Transporter Bridge put the city on the map, and Miranda Krestovnikoff heads to Bempton Cliffs.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: Neil Oliver admires ginger seals at Walton-on-the-Naze, while Nick Crane examines the area's fossil record. Miranda Krestovnikoff explores research into the thornback ray on the Thames Estuary and how it aids conservation. The team also visits Felixstowe, the UK's busiest container port, where HM Revenue and Customs uncover a stash of cocaine smuggled among furniture.

programme.title: Deadliest Crash: Disaster at Le Mans
programme.desc: Documentary examining what caused Pierre Levegh's Mercedes to crash into the crowd during the 1955 Le Mans 24-hour race, killing more than 80 people - an accident that remains the worst in the history of motor racing. Among the theories discussed are the use of untested technologies by the car's manufacturers, the addition of a lethal fuel additive and allegations of reckless driving by future Formula One world champion Mike Hawthorn, who won the race with Jaguar team partner Ivor Bueb. Narrated by Jack Deam.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: Part two of two. A re-examination of Jack the Ripper's crimes, revealing how the story known today was shaped by the sensationalist press of 1888. Featuring contributions from Ripper expert Donald Rumbelow and writer Hallie Rubenhold, author of The Five - the only book to tell the lives of the victims.

programme.title: Narrow Escapes of World War Two
programme.desc: First hand accounts of America's opening air raid on the Japanese archipelago, led by Colonel Jimmy Doolittle.

programme.title: World War Weird
programme.desc: Bizarre events during wartime, featuring a Nazi anti-gravity device, phantom cities built during the Second World War, Stalin's cursed tomb and poultry of mass destruction.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The programme looks at a mysterious group of rusting ships stranded in an arid desert, and a monstrous defensive line on the snow-covered peaks of the Italian Alps.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: David Attenborough observes some of the varied species to be found in tropical rainforests, from the amusing courtship rituals of the birds of paradise and a chimpanzee group defending its territory to a flying-frog mating orgy and the sinister parasitic fungi cordyceps, which eat their victims alive.

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: Neil Oliver admires ginger seals at Walton-on-the-Naze, while Nick Crane examines the area's fossil record. Miranda Krestovnikoff explores research into the thornback ray on the Thames Estuary and how it aids conservation. The team also visits Felixstowe, the UK's busiest container port, where HM Revenue and Customs uncover a stash of cocaine smuggled among furniture.

programme.title: Africa
programme.desc: David Attenborough looks at the varied creatures of the Congo rainforest, one of the most competitive habitats on Earth. A sweet-toothed chimpanzee uses a complex array of tools to access honey from a beehive, the elusive picathartes bird feeds unsuspecting frogs to its dinosaur-like chicks and a massive female python reveals her maternal side as she sunbathes to incubate her eggs. Tiny leaf-folding frogs battle it out kung fu style, and as darkness falls the forest elephants gather to face their rivals.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: Following the epic journey of a humpback whale and its calf as they travel from a tropical paradise to the species' great feeding ground in the icy polar seas. David Attenborough also observes footage of colonies of seabirds in the Arabian desert and surfing dolphins in Australia that swim onto the beach to catch their fish.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The history of pioneering modern-day mega structures, revealing that behind every seemingly impossible marvel of modern engineering is a cast of historic trailblazing engineers who designed new building techniques, took risks on untested materials and revolutionised their field. The first programme focuses on the aircraft carrier.

programme.title: Narrow Escapes of World War Two
programme.desc: Stories of people who came close to losing their lives during the Second World War, beginning with tales about the Chindits, the army's elite jungle troops division who beat the Japanese in a daring mission.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Acclaimed chronicle of the Second World War, beginning with an account of Hitler's ascent to power at a time when the Germans were stricken by humiliating military defeat, runaway inflation and economic depression. The Nazi leader's promises of regained national pride and prosperity struck a chord with millions of ordinary citizens, and he was elected on a tidal wave of popular support. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The underground base with the power to destroy a nation, the site linked with an attempt to kill a vicious dictator, and an ancient world discovered in the open American wilderness.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: Chinese authorities attempt a huge infrastructure project as they try to move vast amounts of water from the wet south of the country to the dry north.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletch plans to bring a bit of Christmas spirit to Slade Prison in the form of his own home-made booze. But when Mackay and Barrowclough uncover the stash in his and Godber's cell, the crafty con seems in danger of spending the yuletide period in solitary confinement. Festive edition of the classic comedy from 1976, starring Ronnie Barker and Fulton Mackay.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletch discovers fellow inmates at Slade Prison are planning an escape over Christmas - and is so convinced the bid is doomed to fail that he takes refuge in the hospital so he cannot be blamed when the tunnel is found. Festive edition of the classic comedy from 1975, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: An abandoned prison beneath the water, a tunnel in the heart of a mountain, concrete towers hidden in the woods and a rusting coastal relic.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The history of pioneering modern-day mega structures, revealing that behind every seemingly impossible marvel of modern engineering is a cast of historic trailblazing engineers who designed new building techniques, took risks on untested materials and revolutionised their field. The first programme focuses on the aircraft carrier.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The team investigates after a man convicted of murdering his parents escapes from a psychiatric unit and reveals the location of a decomposed corpse. The remains are identified as those of a student who went missing in the 1960s, and a link is made between the two crimes. However, time is of the essence in tracking down their suspect when an elderly psychiatrist is taken captive.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Honey is interviewed by Adam and fights to save her career, insisting she was abducted by new husband Scott. JT begins to suspect Gina has cancer, and Dan alleges Amber has been blackmailing him to do menial duties on her behalf, while Yvonne is devastated to learn Lee Thomas, the young thug she forcibly restrained at the cemetery, has died of his injuries.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: The propane cylinder storage depot blaze continues, leaving Jaffa badly burned and plunging George into agonies of guilt. Nick clashes with Skase over how to handle the emergency, and later learns to his dismay that Ariadne has gone missing, while on a quieter note, Recall and Laura enjoy a break from the children. Andrew Kazamia, Glen Murphy, and Richard Walsh star.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Lieutenant Colonel Philip Drysdale, the new CO, arrives with his traditional views on army life and is unimpressed the attitude of B Company's men.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: The arrival of strict new sergeant-major Alan Fitzpatrick causes quite a stir among the ranks, while memories of traumatic episode from Hobbs' past come flooding back during an exercise, threatening his chances of promotion. The boys persuade a reluctant Butcher to invest in a greyhound and the wives reveal their competitive side while organising a charity auction.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Honey is interviewed by Adam and fights to save her career, insisting she was abducted by new husband Scott. JT begins to suspect Gina has cancer, and Dan alleges Amber has been blackmailing him to do menial duties on her behalf, while Yvonne is devastated to learn Lee Thomas, the young thug she forcibly restrained at the cemetery, has died of his injuries.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Diane returns to work but she and Jac take an instant dislike to one another - and Ric does not help matters by suggesting they both apply for the consultant's job. Mickie is not impressed when new nurse Kyla takes an extended break, but softens once she learns the reason. Mark's animosity toward Ben's mother softens, but Lola still thinks he is getting too involved in the case - especially as the boy's chances of survival ebb away.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Adam reveals he is HIV-positive, placing Charlie in the unenviable position of deciding what action _ if any _ he should take. Sunny proves to be something of a loose cannon, allowing his temper to get the better of him, and an accident prompts a grandmother to accept a few home truths. Medical drama, starring Derek Thompson and Ian Bleasdale.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part one of three. Yvonne is suspended from duty pending further investigation into the death of young thug Lee Thomas, and Leela is also accused of assaulting a suspect, leaving the relief uncertain as to what constitutes reasonable force when making an arrest. Fearful of leaving himself open to accusations of heavy-handedness or police brutality, Tony later hesitates to use force in a confrontation with local youths - and suffers a horrific beating. Meanwhile Zain Nadir agrees to do a stint in CID before beginning his next undercover job.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Danny begs Pauline to run away with him. Husband Greg begs Christine to have him back - where does this leave Arthur? Grant tells Sharon he's met someone.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Grant explores a romantic interest under the watchful and jealous eyes of Sharon and Michelle warns Shelley against pursuing a relationship with Mark.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Jaffa is seriously injured when the Blue Watch team attends a nightmarish scenario of burning cars and houses, while Nick mounts a desperate search for Ariadne.

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: Archie decides to turn Jamie's room into a nursery, while Lexie becomes convinced there is a ghost in the house after she sees a mysterious figure at the window. Duncan is prompted to take control of his relationship with Irene when she talks about leaving Glenbogle, and Molly is less than impressed with the new neighbour.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Karen tentatively looks forward to seeing her mother for the first time in 25 years, but unfortunately the reunion doesn't turn out as she hoped. Relations are hardly any more harmonious elsewhere, as Oscar continues to give Cheryl the cold shoulder _ leading to a devastating accident at home. Popular drama, starring Leslie Ash and Philip Middlemiss.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Joey goes to inform Martina that the family will be holidaying in Rome for the Christmas period.

programme.title: Hi-de-Hi!
programme.desc: Clive's relatives descend on the camp in an effort to stop his marriage to Gladys - which could give the groom-to-be the excuse he has been looking for. Classic comedy, starring David Griffin, Paul Shane and Ruth Madoc.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Lionel and Jean take care of Stephen while Penny goes into hospital for a routine operation - but their task is complicated by a case of mistaken identity. Geoffrey Palmer, Judi Dench and Moira Brooker star.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Clegg persuades Compo and Blamire to buy a car so they can get around more easily, but the old banger they end up with turns out to be more trouble than it is worth.

programme.title: Inspector George Gently
programme.desc: An elderly man is killed in his dilapidated mansion, prompting Gently and Bacchus to delve into the building's past as a children's home. They soon have their prime suspect - a man who once lived there - but it becomes clear that some of the locals, including property developer Cora Davidson, have something to hide. Feature-length drama, guest starring Matthew McNulty and Jill Halfpenny, with Martin Shaw and Lee Ingleby.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: When a retrospective exhibition of murdered fashion designer Ritchie Levene's work opens, the team is prompted to re-examine the three-year-old crime. The detectives learn about his tempestuous relationships with his new spouse, personal assistant and ex-wife Sarah, who believes his brother Adrian is the killer because he had the most to gain from his death. Meanwhile, Gerry enlists Emily to help update his image, although not everyone is impressed with the results. Crime drama, guest starring Rupert Graves and Hannah Waterman.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Boyd receives a Nazi ceremonial dagger in an anonymous package in the post. The weapon prompts him to reopen the unsolved murder file of a girl whose body was found on the street in May 1945 - a case last examined by his former colleague Mel Silver shortly before her death. Feature-length crime drama, starring Trevor Eve and Sue Johnston.

programme.title: Belgravia
programme.desc: John appeals to members of the Trenchards' staff in his bid to uncover the truth about Charles, while Turton and Ellis are quick to betray their employers and prove surprisingly adept at deceit and spying. Susan makes a seemingly miraculous discovery, and begrudgingly agrees to accompany Anne and James to their country estate in the hope of extracting further information about Oliver. Stephen makes a last-ditch attempt to secure the funds he needs to pay off his debt - a deal that puts his life in danger.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Barging Round Britain with John Sergeant
programme.desc: The broadcaster returns to travel more of Britain's canal network, exploring the extraordinary stories of the people and places on the way. The series starts with John navigating the Peak Forest Canal, which runs through stunning countryside from Buxworth in Derbyshire to Ashton-under-Lyne. Along the way, in Hyde he meets former boxer Ricky Hatton, who discusses his plans to revitalise the area and offer new opportunities to local youngsters, and joins a team of junior archaeologists at Mellor Mill, who are attempting to unearth the remains of what was once one of the world's largest mills.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: The GMB team is joined by Lorraine Kelly for the final hour, with the latest on the coronavirus pandemic, as well as other stories.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: A mix of celebrity chat, lifestyle features, advice and competitions.

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Another helping of topical studio discussion from a female perspective, featuring celebrity interviews.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: James Martin's Islands to Highlands
programme.desc: On the next leg of his Islands to Highlands tour, James travels to Devon where he meets his friend and Michelin-starred chef Simon Hulstone. While they are in the area, James visits a mushroom farm, and Simon samples some award-winning cheese, which inspires James to prepare an extravagant cheese platter.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: A family of five from Essex calling themselves Showaddiwaddilove answer questions about top 10 lists, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Game show, hosted by Warwick Davis.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as four contestants pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. Chris, Gail, Joe and Clara work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Jamie explains to Paddy that the only way to solve his money problems is to fire Belle, Al and Priya share a passionate kiss and Malone puts Billy in a difficult position.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Gemma boards the bus with the quads, but is suddenly overcome by a wave of anxiety and hurries off the bus, leaving her babies behind. The return of Rick's daughter Kelly rattles Gary, and Yasmeen consults the police about Geoff's past.

programme.title: Kate & Koji
programme.desc: When word reaches that a storm is headed for town, Kate refuses to step in line, much to the grief of Councillor Bone. Koji discovers he has been given a jacket with an unfortunate history, and Medium may have lost Kate a lot of money on the horses. Comedy, starring Brenda Blethyn and Jimmy Akingbola.

programme.title: Paul O'Grady: For the Love of Dogs
programme.desc: The comedian follows the work of Battersea Dogs & Cats Home in London, meeting staff involved in treating, training and rehoming animals. This time, Paul meets a 10-month-old puppy who has been brought into Battersea twice for being too boisterous, before helping to soothe a pointer cross who has had a hard life.

programme.title: The Trouble with Maggie Cole
programme.desc: As the drama concludes, Roxanna is terrified by Alex's behaviour the previous night, and tries desperately to get to Alex before he confronts the money lenders. Meanwhile, Jill is still feeling shaken after witnessing Peter and Karen kissing and wonders if she should tell Maggie what has happened. As everyone gathers for the village celebrations, a sudden shocking series of events are put in motion that could potentially cost the life of one beloved villager. Starring Dawn French, Mark Heap and Gwyneth Keyworth.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: Peston
programme.desc: Political magazine show presented by Robert Peston, featuring major interviews with MPs, topical guests and cultural figures. Including updates from social media taking in perspectives from viewers, experts and key players throughout the programme.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Warwick Davis in which a team of family and friends answers questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then tries to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer and Edd China try to make a profit on their first electric project as they restore a 1985 Maserati Bi-Turbo that was converted to electric in the early 1990s.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: Eccentric military equipment collector Bruce Crompton heads to Ypres in Belgium looking for items from the Great War. He tracks down a German trench mortar and also goes for a ride in a First World War-era British tank - one of the first tanks ever used in combat.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.sub-title: The Jeanette Lee Black Widow Bike
programme.desc: Mikey is ready to make amends after returning from rehab, while the OCC team builds a Black Widow bike for pool champion Jeanette Lee.

programme.title: Airplane Repo
programme.desc: Ken Cage attempts to get a pair of high-end yachts in two days, and Kevin Lacey's favour for a friend turns into a white-knuckle landing in Texas.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike Rowe explores a cricket farm in Georgia and discovers how 25 million insects are managed. Later, he heads farther afield to talk about turkey with experts.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.sub-title: LED Stage Lights/Apple Cider/Chemical Tank Trailers/Stone Floors
programme.desc: The technology behind the manufacture of LED stage lights, apple cider, chemical tank trailers and stone floors.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.sub-title: Fishing Line/Industrial Mixers/Natural Baking Soda/Tow Trucks
programme.desc: The technology behind the manufacture of fishing line, industrial mixers, natural baking soda and tow trucks.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: Tips for brewing moonshine in the heart of New York City. Plus, the creation of a battery-powered bicycle, and producing wetsuits using rubber grown in the Arizona desert.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole tries to restore a monkey bike, and Simon O'Brien makes use of all his skills as he tries to give new life to an old racing bicycle.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: The Northwestern's skipper pushes himself to the limit in an effort to capture the fabled blue king crab, and the crew doubts his decisions when a storm starts to close in.

programme.title: Gold Divers
programme.desc: The fleet fights for its season goals, with Captain Vernon Adkison and Captain Emily Riedel looking for last-minute recruits.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mike Brewer and mechanic Edd China are excited to get their hands on a Porsche 944 Turbo, but the restoration does not run smoothly.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Auto enthusiast Mike Brewer and mechanic Edd China continue to restore the Porsche 944 Turbo, using all their skills to overhaul the sports car.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Auto enthusiast Mike Brewer and mechanic Edd China tackle one of their biggest challenges to date - renovating an Audi Quattro.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Mike Brewer and Edd China continue with their Audi Quattro renovation project.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Car restorer Wayne Carini fears a contact may have something to hide when he refuses to send photographs of some high-end classics he has on offer.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Car restorer Wayne Carini travels to Atlanta to see a rare Ferrari 275 GS, but an ownership dispute threatens the deal.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Car restorer Wayne Carini finds out what happened to some of his past projects, including a Rolls-Royce that ended up at the Pebble Beach Concours d'Elegance charity event.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Car restorer Wayne Carini is delighted to find a 1963 427 Cobra in a barn, and he and Roger manage to get it running and take it for a ride.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: Classic Cars
programme.desc: Salvage aficionado, Drew Pritchard teams up with Turbo Pickers' Paul Cowland for an epic motoring mission as the pair scour the UK, buying, restoring and selling classic cars.

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon Lovegrove are off to the West Country and Oxfordshire in search of vintage treasure to buy, restore and flog. Their discoveries include rare motoring memorabilia, 1970's kitsch and a fabulous collection of stationary engines.

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon Lovegrove search a Cornish surf shack, where they find a bevy of custom bikes, surf buggies and all kinds of weird and wonderful objects. Is there a nice little earner lurking in Cornwall?.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: Eccentric military equipment collector Bruce Crompton finds a picture in his attic from Dunkirk, given to him by a soldier who was there. He tjhen goes on a hunt for kit that tells the real story of the wartime evacuation.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: In Seaton, Devon, Drew Pritchard dashes under a staircase for a pair of floodlights. In Yorkshire, he uses a penknife to see if a newly upholstered chair hides a valuable original.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: The restorers face a challenge with Chesterfield sofa rescued from the scrapheap. Plus, they set out to revive a shattered marble figurine and a broken French bakery counter.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer and Edd China try to make a profit on their first electric project as they restore a 1985 Maserati Bi-Turbo that was converted to electric in the early 1990s.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Simon O'Brien finds a barn containing a collection of replica Rolls-Royce cars, and Henry Cole tries his hand at driving a tractor as they continue their money-making tour.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: At a medieval castle in Cumbria, Drew Pritchard tries a seal a deal on the ultimate car accessory, and is later offered a blast from the past when visiting a meticulous motor museum.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: Classic Cars
programme.desc: Salvage aficionado, Drew Pritchard teams up with Paul Cowland for a motoring mission, scouring the UK, buying, restoring and selling classic cars.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: On a 100-acre property in Arkansas, Mike Wolfe falls hard for a midget race car with a Knucklehead motor and prize-winning pedigree.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The world's biggest land vehicles as they mine 90,000 tons of coal a day, and the hunt for alligators in the Florida swamps.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The construction of steam turbines and racing cars. Plus, how black boxes are built to survive plane crashes.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mechanic Edd China surprises auto enthusiast Mike Brewer Mike back in England by purchasing a vintage 1916 Cadillac. The duo work hard to get the car ready for a 9,000-mile endurance rally known as Peking to Paris.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Forensic officers use a brand new technique to catch a killer who attempted to conceal his tracks by incinerating the evidence.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case of Andrew Nesbitt, found dead on his 46th birthday in his Wisconsin apartment after a night out. Officers sought clues from CCTV in local bars, cabs and street corners.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The case of 25-year-old waitress Zilpha Lowery who vanished in July 1993. Foul play was immediately suspected as rumours of Lowery's fate spread through her North Carolina town and tied her to another mysterious disappearance. Her body was found with its skull crushed several months later, but it would be another 13 years before a tip led detectives out of state to find their man.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The nationwide manhunt for serial killer Christopher Wilder, who posed as a fashion photographer to lure unsuspecting victims to his Florida estate. As the net closed in, Wilder went on a cross-country rampage, and it was thanks to a TV campaign that he was finally brought to justice.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Houston SPCA officers rescue a seriously underweight young mare from cruelty.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Documentary following the work of Sydney veterinary surgeon Dr Chris Brown, set against the backdrop of the city's iconic beach.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Cherine's fantasy is to resemble an Egyptian Barbie on her wedding day, while Jessica seeks a dress that will look good with fairy wings.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: A bride who loves peacocks and another who loves purple battle with their bridesmaids, while another prays pink dresses will save her wedding day.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: Selfish sisters are running wild in the salon, causing dress-shopping chaos for the brides. Lori and her team race to control the sibling rivalry.

programme.title: Bondi Vet: Coast to Coast
programme.desc: Dr Danni Dusek helps her friend's cat that keeps fighting with its neighbour. Meanwhile, Dr Peter Ricci struggles to get close to Lottie the ferocious and frightened Chihuahua.

programme.title: Bondi Vet: Coast to Coast
programme.desc: Dr Alex Hynes tries to treat a Labrador-staffy cross that has been attacked by another dog. Plus, carers attend to an American bulldog which has eaten a whole packet of macadamia nuts.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Chief investigator Jim Boller and his team are given an unusual and potentially hazardous task - moving four black bears from a roadside zoo to their secure shelter.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: The team wades through thick mud to retrieve a wild boar, and rescues ostriches found abandoned without food.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Forensic detectives demonstrate how killers who spill even a drop of blood always run the risk of leaving themselves open to identification. Plus, an incident involving a woman struck by a train.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The story of 28 year-old bride-to-be Marilyn 'Niqui' McCown, who disappeared after visiting a laundromat near her home in Richmond, Indiana in July 2001. To add to the mystery, four months later Niqui's abandoned truck was found 40 miles away.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The story of Tim Carney, who vanished on his way to church for morning prayers. The mystery deepened when his car was later retrieved from the airport and his bank account found to have been almost emptied.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The investigation into the murder of New Jersey state trooper Phillip Lamanco, whose killers were connected to terrorism.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Sonya and her fiance have conflicting opinions as to what kind of gown she should wear. Meanwhile, Shelby has been to more than 20 salons in search of her perfect dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Cynthia's biggest critic is her eight-year-old bridesmaid, while Kayla and her mother have conflicting opinions as to what kind of dress is best.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Bride-to-be Tammi has just 10 weeks until her wedding and is looking for a princess gown with Cinderella sleeves.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Professional dancer Karina is looking for a dress different to the costumes she usually wears in her shows, but loves every gown in sight and has trouble making a decision.

programme.title: Curvy Brides Boutique
programme.desc: Since her first visit, Rebecca has lost so much weight that her dress no longer fits. Plus, it's an emotional fitting for cancer-survivor Natalie.

programme.title: Curvy Brides Boutique
programme.desc: Behind the scenes at a wedding dress shop catering to larger customers.

programme.title: French Collection
programme.desc: Three bargain hunters search for valuables at a market in Nice, then upcycle their goods before selling them in the UK. Nathalie opts for traditional French, picking up some antique shutters, David gives a small chest of drawers the shabby chic treatment, and haggler Jane buys a mirror for 70 euros, pinning her hopes on it being worth much more.

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: Prestige Pawnbrokers boss James Constantinou and the team receive a visit from a former Chelsea footballer who has brought along some expensive watches. James is also put to the test when asked to evaluate a hovercraft from a Bond film, and an unusual painting of Saddam Hussein causes a stir in the office. Also, there's a big surprise for a mother looking to sell some spectacular jewellery to help her son's business venture.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Self-described 'secret eater' Doug is managing to hide his snacking. However, his obesity is stopping him from living a full life with his wife, who is now demanding a change.

programme.title: Saving Babies
programme.desc: Baby Casper arrives on the unit, having been born at the 23rd week of pregnancy, 17 weeks before his due date. He's on the very edge of viability and the very edge of survival.

programme.title: Body Bizarre
programme.desc: The stories of a girl was born with a genetic disorder that left her with a deformed mouth and jaw, and a boy born with his organs back to front and no jaw at all.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: Examining a murder investigation in which police turned to the FBI's crime laboratory after encountering difficulties in identifying a woman's body.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Scientists use forensic evidence to piece together the stories of soldiers who went to war but never returned.
